description: Global SMS & Voice calls for businesses of all sizes

blocks.name: getAccountDetails
blocks.description: You can call this API to retrieve details like email address, cash credits, postal address, auto recharge settings, etc which is associated with your Plivo account. Returns an object representing your Plivo account.

blocks.name: updateAccount
blocks.description: If you would like to modify your account details, you could do so with this API. You can make changes to the name, city and the address fields.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the account holder or business.

blocks.name: createSubaccount
blocks.description: A subaccount is an account that is owned by a parent account. Using a subaccount makes it easier to segment, manage, and keep track of the account usages of each user independently.

args.name: enabled
args.info: Specify if the subaccount should be enabled or not. Takes a value of True or False. Defaults to False

blocks.name: updateSubaccount
blocks.description: If you would like to modify your subaccount, you could do so with this API. You can make changes to the name of the subaccount and specify whether to enable or disable it.

args.name: enabled
args.info: Specify if the subaccount should be enabled or not. Takes a value of True or False. Defaults to False

blocks.name: getSingleSubaccount
blocks.description: You can call this API to retrieve details of a subaccount like auth_id, auth_token, etc. Returns an object representing your Plivo subaccount.

blocks.name: getSubaccounts
blocks.description: You can get details of all subaccounts associated with your main Plivo account. We return a list of all subaccounts.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

blocks.name: deleteSubaccount
blocks.description: You can delete a subaccount with this API. This API would delete the subaccount and associate all Number, Endpoints and Applications (which are linked to the subaccount) to the main Plivo account.

blocks.name: createApplication
blocks.description: Create an application on Plivo by calling this API. Creating an application is usually the first step, after which you would attach this application either to a number or an endpoint.

args.name: answerUrl
args.info: The URL Plivo will fetch when a call executes this application.

args.name: answerMethod
args.info: The method used to call the answer_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: hangupUrl
args.info: The URL that will be notified by Plivo when the call hangs up. Defaults to answer_url. More details

args.name: hangupMethod
args.info: The method used to call the hangup_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: fallbackAnswerUrl
args.info: Invoked by Plivo only if answer_url is unavailable or the XML response is invalid. Should contain a XML response.

args.name: fallbackMethod
args.info: The method used to call the fallback_answer_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: messageUrl
args.info: The URL that will be notified by Plivo when an inbound message is received. Defaults not set. More details

args.name: messageMethod
args.info: The method used to call the message_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: defaultNumberApp
args.info: Boolean parameter. If set to true, this parameter ensures that newly created numbers, which don't have an app_id, point to this application.

args.name: defaultEndpointApp
args.info: Boolean parameter. If set to true, this parameter ensures that newly created endpoints, which don't have an app_id, point to this application.

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Id of the subaccount, in case only subaccount applications are needed.

blocks.name: getApplications
blocks.description: Theis API is used to get details of all the application that have been created under your Plivo account.

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Id of the subaccount, in case only subaccount applications are needed.

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

blocks.name: getSingleApplication
blocks.description: Get details of an particular application by passing the app_id. This API returns all the information linked with the application.

blocks.name: updateApplication
blocks.description: Modify an application using this API.

args.name: answerUrl
args.info: The URL Plivo will fetch when a call executes this application.

args.name: answerMethod
args.info: The method used to call the answer_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: hangupUrl
args.info: The URL that will be notified by Plivo when the call hangs up. Defaults to answer_url. More details

args.name: hangupMethod
args.info: The method used to call the hangup_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: fallbackAnswerUrl
args.info: Invoked by Plivo only if answer_url is unavailable or the XML response is invalid. Should contain a XML response.

args.name: fallbackMethod
args.info: The method used to call the fallback_answer_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: messageUrl
args.info: The URL that will be notified by Plivo when an inbound message is received. Defaults not set. More details

args.name: messageMethod
args.info: The method used to call the message_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: defaultNumberApp
args.info: Boolean parameter. If set to true, this parameter ensures that newly created numbers, which don't have an app_id, point to this application.

args.name: defaultEndpointApp
args.info: Boolean parameter. If set to true, this parameter ensures that newly created endpoints, which don't have an app_id, point to this application.

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Id of the subaccount, in case only subaccount applications are needed.

blocks.name: deleteApplication
blocks.description: This API would delete the Plivo application. Use this API wisely, once an application is deleted, it cannot be retrived.

blocks.name: makeCall
blocks.description: The following API enables you to make a single call or bulk outbound calls to real phone(s) or SIP endpoint(s).

args.name: callFrom
args.info: The phone number to be used as the caller id (with the country code).For e.g, a USA caller id number could be, 15677654321, with '1' for the country code.

args.name: callTo
args.info: The regular number(s) or sip endpoint(s) to call. Regular number must be prefixed with country code but without the + sign). For e.g, to dial a number in the USA, the number could be, 15677654321, with '1' for the country code. Multiple numbers can be sent by using a delimiter. For e.g. 15677654321<12077657621<12047657621. Sip endpoints must be prefixed with sip: E.g., sip:john1234@phone.plivo.com. To make bulk calls, the delimiter < is used. For example, 15677654321<15673464321<sip:john1234@phone.plivo.com Yes, you can mix regular numbers and sip endpoints.

args.name: answerUrl
args.info: The URL invoked by Plivo when the outbound call is answered.

args.name: answerMethod
args.info: The method used to call the answer_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: ringUrl
args.info: The URL that is notified by Plivo when the call is ringing. Defaults not set.

args.name: ringMethod
args.info: The method used to call the ring_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: hangupUrl
args.info: The URL that is notified by Plivo when the call hangs up. Defaults to answer_url.

args.name: hangupMethod
args.info: The method used to call the hangup_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: fallbackUrl
args.info: Invoked by Plivo only if answer_url is unavailable or the XML response is invalid. Should contain a XML response.

args.name: fallbackMethod
args.info: The method used to call the fallback_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: callerName
args.info: Caller name to use with the call.

args.name: sendDigits
args.info: Plivo plays DTMF tones when the call is answered. This is useful when dialing a phone number and an extension. Plivo will dial the number, and when the automated system picks up, sends the DTMF tones to connect to the extension. E.g. If you want to dial the 2410 extension after the call is connected, and you want to wait for a few seconds before sending the extension, add a few leading 'w' characters. Each 'w' character waits 0.5 second before sending a digit. Each 'W' character waits 1 second before sending a digit. You can also add the tone duration in ms by appending @duration after the string (default duration is 2000 ms). For example, 1w2w3@1000 See the DTMF API for additional information.

args.name: sendOnPreanswer
args.info: If set to true and send_digits is also set, digits are sent when the call is in preanswer state. Defaults to false.

args.name: timeLimit
args.info: Schedules the call for hangup at a specified time after the call is answered. Value should be an integer > 0(in seconds).

args.name: hangupOnRing
args.info: Schedules the call for hangup at a specified time after the call starts ringing. Value should be an integer >= 0 (in seconds).

args.name: machineDetection
args.info: Used to detect if the call has been answered by a machine. The valid values are true and hangup. Default time to analyze is 5000 milliseconds (or 5 seconds). You can change it with the machine_detection_time parameter. Note that no XML is processed during the analysis phase. If a machine is detected during the call and machine_detection is set to true, the Machine parameter will be set to true and will be sent to the answer_url, hangup_url, or any other URL that is invoked by the call. If a machine is detected during the call and machine_detection is set to hangup, the call hangs up immediately and a request is made to the hangup_url with the Machine parameter set to true

args.name: machineDetectionTime
args.info: Time allotted to analyze if the call has been answered by a machine. It should be an integer >= 2000 and <= 10000 and the unit is ms. The default value is 5000 ms.

args.name: machineDetectionUrl
args.info: A URL where machine detection parameters will be sent by Plivo. This parameter should be used to make machine detection asynchronous

args.name: machineDetectionMethod
args.info: The HTTP method which will be used by Plivo to request the machine_detection_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: sipHeaders
args.info: List of SIP headers in the form of 'key=value' pairs, separated by commas. E.g. head1=val1,head2=val2,head3=val3,...,headN=valN. The SIP headers are always prefixed with X-PH-. The SIP headers are present for every HTTP request made by the outbound call. Only [A-Z], [a-z] and [0-9] characters are allowed for the SIP headers key and value. Additionally, the '%' character is also allowed for the SIP headers value so that you can encode this value in the URL.

args.name: ringTimeout
args.info: Determines the time in seconds the call should ring. If the call is not answered within the ring_timeout value or the default value of 120s, it is canceled.

args.name: parentCallUuid
args.info: The call_uuid of the first leg in an ongoing conference call. It is recommended to use this parameter in scenarios where a member who is already present in the conference intends to add new members by initiating outbound API calls. This minimizes the delay in adding a new memeber to the conference.

args.name: errorIfParentNotFound
args.info: if set to true and the parent_call_uuid cannot be found, the API request would return an error. If set to false, the outbound call API request will be executed even if the parent_call_uuid is not found. Defaults to false.

blocks.name: getCallsDetails
blocks.description: The following API enables you to get information about all completed calls. The maximum number of results that can be fetched with a single API call is 20.

args.name: callDirection
args.info: Filter the results by call direction. The valid inputs are inbound and outbound.

args.name: fromNumber
args.info: Filter the results by the number from where the call originated.

args.name: toNumber
args.info: Filter the results by the number to which the call was made.

args.name: billDuration
args.info: Filter the results according to billed duration.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Filter out calls according to the time of completion.

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. E.g., If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

blocks.name: getSingleCallDetails
blocks.description: The following API enables you to get information about all completed calls. The maximum number of results that can be fetched with a single API call is 20.

blocks.name: getLiveCalls
blocks.description: Get all current active calls made from an account.

blocks.name: getSingleLiveCallDetails
blocks.description: Get information on an active call.

blocks.name: hangupSingleCall
blocks.description: Hangup an incoming or outgoing call.

blocks.name: hangupCalls
blocks.description: Hangup all incoming or outgoing calls.

blocks.name: transferCall
blocks.description: This API enables an in-progress or active call to a different URL and fetch and execute XML from a new URL. If the call (the A leg) is in a Dial, you can also transfer the other party (the B leg) at the same time or only transfer the B leg to an URL. This is useful for many applications where you want to asynchronously change the behavior of a live call. For example, you can play music while the call is on hold, queue calls, transfer calls etc.

args.name: legs
args.info: aleg, bleg or both Defaults to aleg. aleg will transfer call_uuid ; bleg will transfer the bridged leg (if found) of call_uuid ; both will transfer call_uuid and bridged leg of call_uuid

args.name: alegUrl
args.info: URL to transfer for aleg, if legs is aleg or both, then aleg_url has to be specified.

args.name: alegMethod
args.info: HTTP method to invoke aleg_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: blegUrl
args.info: URL to transfer for bridged leg, if legs is bleg or both, then bleg_url has to be specified.

args.name: blegMethod
args.info: HTTP method to invoke bleg_url. Defaults to POST.

blocks.name: recordCall
blocks.description: Record a Call

args.name: timeLimit
args.info: Max recording duration in seconds. Defaults to 60.

args.name: fileFormat
args.info: The format of the recording. The valid formats are mp3 and wav formats. Defaults to mp3.

args.name: transcriptionType
args.info: The type of transcription required. The following values are allowed: auto - This is the default value. Transcription is completely automated; turnaround time is about 5 minutes. hybrid - Transcription is a combination of automated and human verification processes; turnaround time is about 10-15 minutes.

args.name: transcriptionUrl
args.info: The URL where the transcription is available.

args.name: transcriptionMethod
args.info: The method used to invoke the transcription_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: The URL invoked by the API when the recording ends. The following parameters are sent to the callback_url: `api_id` - the same API ID returned by the call record API. `record_url` - the URL to access the recorded file. `call_uuid` - the call uuid of the recorded call. `recordingId` - the recording ID of the recorded call. `recordingDuration` - duration in seconds of the recording. `recordingDurationMs` - duration in milliseconds of the recording. `recordingStartMs` - when the recording started (epoch time UTC) in milliseconds. `recordingEndMs` - when the recording ended (epoch time UTC) in milliseconds.

args.name: callbackMethod
args.info: The method which is used to invoke the callback_url URL. Defaults to POST.

blocks.name: stopCallRecording
blocks.description: Stop Recording a Call

blocks.name: playMusicFile
blocks.description: Play a Music File

args.name: urls
args.info: A single URL or a list of comma separated URLs linking to an mp3 or wav file.

args.name: length
args.info: Maximum length in seconds that the audio should be played.

args.name: legs
args.info: The leg on which the music will be played, can be aleg (i.e., A-leg is the first leg of the call or current call), bleg (i.e., B-leg is the second leg of the call),or both (i.e., both legs of the call).

args.name: loop
args.info: If set to true, the audio file will play indefinitely.

args.name: mix
args.info: If set to true, sounds are mixed with current audio flow.

blocks.name: stopPlayingMusicFile
blocks.description: Stop Playing a Music File

blocks.name: playText
blocks.description: The Speak API lets you play text asynchronously on a live call. These notifications can be useful when played during a live call, for example: ‘Please hold, while we transfer your call’ or ‘Your balance is running low…’, etc.

args.name: voice
args.info: The voice to be used, can be MAN, WOMAN.

args.name: language
args.info: The language to be used, see Supported voices and languages below.

args.name: legs
args.info: The leg on which the text has to be played, can be aleg (i.e., A-leg is the first leg of the call or current call), bleg (i.e., B-leg is the second leg of the call),or both (i.e., both legs of the call).

args.name: loop
args.info: If set to true, the text will play indefinitely.

args.name: mix
args.info: If set to true, the text audio will be mixed in with current call audio.

blocks.name: stopPlayingText
blocks.description: You can asynchronously stop the text which is being played by the Speak API.

blocks.name: sendDigits
blocks.description: Send digits on a call

args.name: leg
args.info: The leg to be used, can be aleg (the current call) or bleg (the other party in a Dial). Defaults to aleg.

blocks.name: hangupCallRequest
blocks.description: Hangup a Call Request

blocks.name: getConferences
blocks.description: Retrieves a list of all conferences which are active on your account. This API returns the names of all the ongoing conferences.

blocks.name: getSingleConference
blocks.description: Retrieves the details of a particular conference.

blocks.name: hangupConferences
blocks.description: This API lets you hangup all ongoing conferences running on your account.

blocks.name: hangupSingleConference
blocks.description: This API lets you hangup a particular conference by using the conference name.

blocks.name: startRecordingConference
blocks.description: This API lets you start recording a live conference.

args.name: fileFormat
args.info: The file format of the record can be of mp3 or wav format. Defaults to mp3 format.

args.name: transcriptionType
args.info: The type of transcription required. The following values are allowed: auto - This is the default value. Transcription is completely automated; turnaround time is about 5 minutes. hybrid - Transcription is a combination of automated and human verification processes; turnaround time is about 10-15 minutes.

args.name: transcriptionUrl
args.info: The URL where the transcription is available.

args.name: transcriptionMethod
args.info: The method used to invoke the transcription_url. Defaults to POST.

args.name: callbackUrl
args.info: The URL invoked by the API when the recording ends. The following parameters are sent to the callback_url: `api_id` - the same API ID returned by the conference record API. `recordUrl` - the URL to access the recorded file. `recordingId` - recording ID of the recorded file. `conferenceName` - the conference name recorded. `recordingDuration` - duration in seconds of the recording. `recordingDurationMs` - duration in milliseconds of the recording. `recordingStartMs` - when the recording started (epoch time UTC) in milliseconds. `recordingEndMs` - when the recording ended (epoch time UTC) in milliseconds.

args.name: callbackMethod
args.info: The method which is used to invoke the callback_url URL. Defaults to POST.

blocks.name: stopRecordingConference
blocks.description: If the recording was initiated by the above Record API call, you could use this API call to stop recording the conference. This is useful when you don’t want to record certain parts of a conference which involves critical details being exchanged on the call.

blocks.name: hangupMember
blocks.description: This API lets you kick a member out of a conference.

blocks.name: kickMember
blocks.description: This API lets you kick a member out of a conference.

blocks.name: muteMember
blocks.description: This API lets you mute members in a conference. When a member is muted, audio from their device will be muted and other members in the conference will not be able to hear the caller.

blocks.name: unmuteMember
blocks.description: This API lets you unmute members which have been muted by the Mute Member API.

blocks.name: playSoundToMember
blocks.description: This API lets you play a mp3 or a wav file to a member in the conference.

args.name: url
args.info: URL of the sound file to be played.

blocks.name: stopPlayingSoundToMember
blocks.description: This API will stop the file which is being played to a member initiated by the Play API

blocks.name: playTextToMember
blocks.description: This API will play text to a member in a conference.

args.name: text
args.info: The text that the member must hear.

args.name: voice
args.info: The voice to be used. Can be MAN or WOMAN. Defaults to WOMAN.

args.name: language
args.info: The language to be used, see Supported voices and languages below. Defaults to en-US.

blocks.name: stopPlayingTextToMember
blocks.description: This API will stop playing text to a member in a conference which was initiated by the Play Text API

blocks.name: makeMemberDeaf
blocks.description: This API lets you deaf a particular member. When this operation is made on a conference member, the member will not be able to hear any audio from the conference.

blocks.name: enableHearingForMember
blocks.description: This API lets you un-deaf a member in a conference.

blocks.name: createEndpoint
blocks.description: This API lets you create a new endpoint on Plivo.

args.name: username
args.info: The username for the endpoint to be created.

args.name: password
args.info: The password for your endpoint username.

args.name: appId
args.info: The app_id of the application that is to be attached to this endpoint.

blocks.name: getSingleEndpoint
blocks.description: This API lets you get details of a single endpoint on your account using the endpointId.

blocks.name: getEndpoints
blocks.description: This API lets you get details of all endpoints. This is pretty useful in use-cases where you want statuses of your endpoints and whether they have been registered using a SIP client.

blocks.name: updateEndpoint
blocks.description: This API lets you modify an endpoint’s password, alias or the application attached to it.

args.name: password
args.info: The password for your endpoint username.

args.name: appId
args.info: The app_id of the application that is to be attached to this endpoint.

blocks.name: deleteEndpoint
blocks.description: This API lets you delete an endpoint. This operation cannot be undone.

blocks.name: sendMessage
blocks.description: This API enables you to send messages via Plivo’s SMS service. The API supports Unicode UTF-8 encoded texts, so you can send messages in any language. The API also handles long SMS automatically by splitting it into standard SMS sized chunks and sending them. Delivery reports are automatically supported in networks where they are provided by the operator.

args.name: src
args.info: The phone number that will be shown as the sender ID. Be sure that all phone numbers include country code, area code, and phone number without spaces or dashes (e.g., 14153336666). Note that a Plivo phone number is required for sending messages to the U.S. or Canada. You can buya Plivo number from the Buy Numbers tab on your Plivo account dashboard.

args.name: destination
args.info: The number to which the message will be sent. Be sure that all phone numbers include country code, area code, and phone number withoutspaces or dashes (e.g., 14153336666). To send messages to multiple numbers, separate your destination phone numbers with the delimiter '<' (e.g., 14156667777<14157778888<14158889999).

args.name: text
args.info: The text message that will be sent. The API will encode the text in Unicode UTF-8 and accepts up to 1000 bytes of UTF-8 encoded text in a single API request. The text will be automatically split into multiple messages and sent separately if the message exceeds the size limit. See notes below for more details.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of message. Should be `sms` for a text message. Defaults to `sms`.

args.name: url
args.info:
The URL to which with the status of the message is sent. 
The following parameters are sent to the URL: 
`To` - Phone number of the recipient 
`From` - Phone number of the sender 
`Status` - Status of the message including 'queued', 'sent', 'failed', 'delivered', 
'undelivered' or 'rejected' 
`MessageUUID` - The unique ID for the message 
`ParentMessageUUID` - ID of the parent message (see notes about long SMS below) 
`PartInfo` - Specifies the sequence of the message (useful for long messages split into 
multiple text messages; see notes about long SMS below) 
`TotalRate` - Total rate per sms 
`TotalAmount` - Total cost of sending the sms (TotalRate * Units) 
`Units` - Number of units into which a long SMS was split 
 `MCC` - Mobile Country Code (see here for more details) 
`MNC` - Mobile Network Code (see here for more details) 
`ErrorCode` - Delivery Response code returned by the carrier attempting the delivery.
 See Supported error codes below.

args.name: method
args.info: The method used to call the url. Defaults nodeto POST.

args.name: log
args.info: If set to false, the content of this message will not be logged on the Plivoinfrastructure and the dst value will be masked (e.g., 141XXXXX528). Default is set to true.

blocks.name: getMessages
blocks.description: Get Details of All Messages

args.name: subaccount
args.info: The id of the subaccount, if message details of the subaccount is needed.

args.name: messageDirection
args.info: Filter the results by message direction. The valid inputs are inbound and outbound.

args.name: messageTime
args.info: Filter out messages according to the time of completion. The filter can be used in the following five forms: messageState (optional),

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

args.name: errorCode
args.info: Delivery Response code returned by the carrier attempting the delivery. See Supported error codes below.

blocks.name: getSingleMessage
blocks.description: Get Details of a Single Message

blocks.name: getRentedNumbers
blocks.description: This API lets you list of numbers rented on Plivo and numbers added to your account.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of number you are filtering. You can filter by local and tollfree numbers. Defaults to a local number.

args.name: numberStartsWith
args.info: Used to specify the beginning of the number. For example, if the number '24' is specified, the API will fetch only those numbers beginning with '24'.

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Requires the auth_id of the subaccount as input. If this parameter is included in the request, all numbers of the particular subaccount are displayed.

args.name: alias
args.info: This is a name given to the number. The API will fetch only those numbers with the alias specified.

args.name: services
args.info: Filters out phone numbers according to the services you want from that number. The following values are valid: voice - Returns a list of numbers that provide 'voice' services. Additionally, if the numbers offer both 'voice' and 'sms', they are also listed. Note - This option does not exclusively list those services that provide both voice and sms . voice,sms - Returns a list of numbers that provide both 'voice' and 'sms' services. sms - Returns a list of numbers that provide only 'sms' services.

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

blocks.name: getRentedNumber
blocks.description: This API lets you get details of a single number on your Plivo account.

blocks.name: addOwnCarrierNumber
blocks.description: This API enables you to add a number of your own carrier.

args.name: numbers
args.info: A comma separated list of numbers that need to be added for the carrier. Make sure that you configure the numbers to point to the sip server @sbc.plivo.com. Eg: If the number you own from your carrier is 18554675486 then the sip address it needs to point to is 18554675486@sbc.plivo.com

args.name: carrier
args.info: The carrier_id of the IncomingCarrier that the number is associated with. For more information, check our IncomingCarrier API

args.name: region
args.info: This is the region that is associated with the Number. You can use it to organize numbers based on the area they are from.

args.name: numberType
args.info: This field does not impact the way Plivo uses this number. It is primarily adding more information about your number. You may use this field tocategorize between local and tollfree numbers. Default is local.

args.name: appId
args.info: The application id of the application that is to be linked.

args.name: subaccount
args.info: The auth_id of the subaccount to which this number should be added. This can only be performed by a main account holder.

blocks.name: updateNumber
blocks.description: This API enables you to change the application and subaccount associated with a number you rented.

args.name: appId
args.info: The application id of the application that is to be linked. If this is set to null, then any existing application is unlinked from the number.

args.name: subaccount
args.info: The auth_id of the subaccount to which this number should be added. This can only be performed by a main account holder.

args.name: alias
args.info: The textual name given to the number.

blocks.name: unrentNumber
blocks.description: This API lets you unrent a number on Plivo. This operation cannot be undone.

blocks.name: searchNewNumbers
blocks.description: This API lets you search for fixed, mobile and tollfree numbers available on Plivo. Searches can be performed based on the country ISO, pattern, number type and region. We return a list of numbers which can then be bought.

args.name: countryIso
args.info: The ISO code A2 of the country ( BE for Belgium, DE for Germany, GB for United Kingdom, US for United States etc ). See the Wikipedia site for a list of ISOs for different countries.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of number you are looking for. The possible number types arefixed, mobile and tollfree. Defaults to any if this field is not specified. type also accepts the value any, which will search for all 3 number types.

args.name: pattern
args.info: Represents the pattern of the number to be searched. Adding a pattern will search for numbers which start with the country code + pattern. For eg. a pattern of 415 and a country_iso: US will search for numbers starting with 1415.

args.name: region
args.info: This filter is only applicable when the type is fixed. If the type is not provided, it is assumed to be fixed. Region based filtering can be performed with the following terms: Exact names of the region: You could use region=Frankfurt if you were looking for a number in Frankfurt. Performed if the search term is three or more characters in length.

args.name: services
args.info: Filters out phone numbers according to the services you want from that number. The following values are valid: voice - If this option is selected, it ensures that the results have voice enabled numbers. These numbers may or may not be SMS enabled. voice,sms - If this option is selected, it ensures that the results have both voice and sms enabled on the same number. sms - If this option is selected, it ensures that the results have sms enabled numbers. These numbers may or may not be voice enabled. By default, numbers that have either voice or sms or both enabled are returned.

args.name: lata
args.info: Numbers can be searched using Local Access and Transport Area. This filter is applicable only for country_iso US and CA.

args.name: rateCenter
args.info: Numbers can be searched using Rate Center. This filter is application only for country_iso US and CA.

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

blocks.name: buyNumber
blocks.description: The number retrieved from the search above should be used as an input to buy the number.

args.name: appId
args.info: The ID of the application that you want assigned to the Number. If not specified, then it is assigned to the default application of the Account.

blocks.name: getPricing
blocks.description: The pricing API lets you retrieve a rates for a country for both inbound and outbound calls.

args.name: countryIso
args.info: The 2 digit country ISO code. eg. US, GB, QA.

blocks.name: getRecordings
blocks.description: List All Recordings

args.name: addTime
args.info: Used to filter out recordings according to the time they were added

args.name: subaccount
args.info: Auth id of the subaccount. Lists only those recordings of the main accounts which are tied to the specified subaccount.

args.name: callUuid
args.info: Used to filter recordings for a specific call.

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

blocks.name: getSingleRecording
blocks.description: The following API is used to retrieve a specific recording based on the recordingId.

blocks.name: deleteRecording
blocks.description: This API lets you delete a recording from your Plivo account using the recording ID.

blocks.name: listIncomingCarriers
blocks.description: This API will list all incoming carrier registered with you account on Plivo.

args.name: name
args.info: Allows filtering by name. The filter term can be one of the following:The exact name of the Carrier Phrase contained within the name the carrier (includes the 'starts with' filter).

args.name: limit
args.info: Used to display the number of results per page. The maximum number of results that can be fetched is 20.

args.name: offset
args.info: Denotes the number of value items by which the results should be offset. Eg:- If the result contains a 1000 values and limit is set to 10 and offset is set to 705, then values 706 through 715 are displayed in the results. This parameter is also used for pagination of the results.

blocks.name: getSingleIncomingCarrier
blocks.description: This API returns the details of an incoming carrier.

blocks.name: addIncomingCarrier
blocks.description: This API lets you add a new incoming carrier to your Plivo account.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the carrier being added. It is just a representation and the name can be chosen at will.

args.name: ipSet
args.info: Comma separated list of ip addresses from which calls belonging to the carrier will reach Plivo. This list will be used by Plivo to allow incoming call traffic into Plivo's servers. If calls come from an IP outside of this list, Plivo will not accept the call.

blocks.name: updateIncomingCarrier
blocks.description: This API lets you modify an existing incoming carrier set up on your account.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the carrier being added. It is just a representation and the name can be chosen at will.

args.name: ipSet
args.info: Comma separated list of ip addresses from which calls belonging to the carrier will reach Plivo. This list will be used by Plivo to allow incoming call traffic into Plivo's servers. If calls come from an IP outside of this list, Plivo will not accept the call.

blocks.name: removeIncomingCarrier
blocks.description: This API lets you remove an incoming carrier added to your account. Please note that removing a carrier will result in all numbers associated with the carrier to be deleted.
